 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->

                </span>

                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->

                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>

                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      ## VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->## VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br><br>### Prolog<span class="line"><!---->### Prolog<!----></span><br><br>While closing a `FileSystemAccessFileWriter` (created from a non-sandboxed file system, eg. get from a file chooser dialog), `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start` will be invoked.<span class="line"><!---->While closing a `FileSystemAccessFileWriter` (created from a non-sandboxed file system, eg. get from a file chooser dialog), `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start` will be invoked.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>interface FileSystemAccessFileWriter {<span class="line"><!---->interface FileSystemAccessFileWriter {<!----></span><br>  // ...<span class="line"><!---->  // ...<!----></span><br>  Close() => (FileSystemAccessError result);<span class="line"><!---->  Close() =&gt; (FileSystemAccessError result);<!----></span><br>  // ...<span class="line"><!---->  // ...<!----></span><br>};<span class="line"><!---->};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/public/mojom/file_system_access/file_system_access_file_writer.mojom;drc=c7fa3ea1647b084f9aa790bf5be3a1ac58e3db78;l=30<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/public/mojom/file_system_access/file_system_access_file_writer.mojom;drc=c7fa3ea1647b084f9aa790bf5be3a1ac58e3db78;l=30"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/public/mojom/file_system_access/file_system_access_file_writer.mojom;drc=c7fa3ea1647b084f9aa790bf5be3a1ac58e3db78;l=30<!----></a><br><br>`CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start` will call `OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone`.<span class="line"><!---->`CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start` will call `OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone`.<!----></span><br><br>```C++<span class="line"><!---->```C++<!----></span><br>void CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start() {<span class="line"><!---->void CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start() {<!----></span><br>  // ...<span class="line"><!---->  // ...<!----></span><br><br>  // If allowlist check passes, FinishRequest() will be called to avoid<span class="line"><!---->  // If allowlist check passes, FinishRequest() will be called to avoid<!----></span><br>  // analyzing file. Otherwise, AnalyzeFile() will be called to continue with<span class="line"><!---->  // analyzing file. Otherwise, AnalyzeFile() will be called to continue with<!----></span><br>  // analysis.<span class="line"><!---->  // analysis.<!----></span><br>  content::GetIOThreadTaskRunner({})->PostTaskAndReplyWithResult(<span class="line"><!---->  content::GetIOThreadTaskRunner({})-&gt;PostTaskAndReplyWithResult(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&CheckUrlAgainstAllowlist, source_url_, database_manager_),<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;CheckUrlAgainstAllowlist, source_url_, database_manager_),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone,<!----></span><br>                     GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->                     GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/check_client_download_request_base.cc;drc=925075a7a9c7c21ec96d9ecad32ccf80e1ab6390;l=118<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/check_client_download_request_base.cc;drc=925075a7a9c7c21ec96d9ecad32ccf80e1ab6390;l=118"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/check_client_download_request_base.cc;drc=925075a7a9c7c21ec96d9ecad32ccf80e1ab6390;l=118<!----></a><br><br>The `OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone` will try to analyze the file content according to the file type in `DownloadRequestMaker::Start`. And `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::OnRequestBuilt` will be the callback for `DownloadRequestMaker::Start`.<span class="line"><!---->The `OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone` will try to analyze the file content according to the file type in `DownloadRequestMaker::Start`. And `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::OnRequestBuilt` will be the callback for `DownloadRequestMaker::Start`.<!----></span><br><br>```C++<span class="line"><!---->```C++<!----></span><br>void class="line"><!---->  download_request_maker_-&gt;Start(base::BindOnce(<!----></span><br>      &CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::OnRequestBuilt, GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->      &amp;CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::OnRequestBuilt, GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span got 3 ASAN logs while testing these code, their USE stacks are different but all of them were born from `DownloadRequestMaker::Start`.<span class="line"><!---->I got 3 ASAN logs while testing these can close the browser to race the access to `BrowserContext` or `Profile`. Fix<span class="line"><!---->## Fix<!----></span><br><br>An effective fix is to let `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase` and `DownloadRequestMaker` inherite the `WebContentsObserver` like this issue: <span class="line"><!---->An effective fix is to let `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase` and `DownloadRequestMaker` inherite the `WebContentsObserver` like this issue: <!----></span>https://crbug.com/1197904<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1197904" title="Security: UAF in NavigationPredictor"><!---->https://crbug.com/1197904<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>## VERSION<span class="line"><!---->## VERSION<!----></span><br><br>Chrome Version: 98.0.4701.0 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 98.0.4701.0 stable<!----></span><br><br>## REPRODUCTION CASE<span class="line"><!---->## REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></span><br><br>1. Run `mkdir gen && mv copy_mojo_js_bindings.py gen`<span class="line"><!---->1. Run `mkdir gen &amp;&amp; mv copy_mojo_js_bindings.py gen`<!----></span><br>2. Host `chooser.html` with a web server, like `python3 -m http.server 8887`<span class="line"><!---->2. Host `chooser.html` with a web server, like `python3 -m http.server 8887`<!----></span><br>3. Run `./chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --incognito <span class="line"><!---->3. Run `./chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --incognito <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8887/chooser.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8887/chooser.html`"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8887/chooser.html`<!----></a><br>4. When a File Chooser Dialog is shown, click 'OK'<!----></span><br><br>You may get 3 different ASAN logs.<span class="line"><!---->You may get 3 different ASAN logs.<!----></span><br><br>In `chooser.html`, I use `MojoJS` to reach the `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start`. But the MojoJS is not necessary since there is another way to reach there in **non-compromised** renderer. Check `download.html`.<span class="line"><!---->In `chooser.html`, I use `MojoJS` to reach the `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start`. But the MojoJS is not necessary since there is another way to reach there in **non-compromised** renderer. Check `download.html`.<!----></span><br><br>Both `CheckClientDownloadRequest` and `CheckFileSystemAccessWriteRequest` inherit from `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase`. The above cases use `CheckFileSystemAccessWriteRequest` but the `CheckClientDownloadRequest` can also reach these code without user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->Both `CheckClientDownloadRequest` and `CheckFileSystemAccessWriteRequest` inherit from `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase`. The above cases use `CheckFileSystemAccessWriteRequest` but the `CheckClientDownloadRequest` can also reach these code without user interaction.<!----></span><br><br>I have tried to reproduce it without `--enable-blink-features=MojoJS` but have not succeeded yet.<span class="line"><!---->I have tried to reproduce it without `--enable-blink-features=MojoJS` but have not succeeded yet.<!----></span><br><br>The `incognito` is not necessary but can make it easy to win the race. The attachment `crash-1-non-incognito.asan` shows the crash log without the `incognito` flag (See the `ALLOCATE` stack).<span class="line"><!---->The `incognito` is not necessary but can make it easy to win the race. The attachment `crash-1-non-incognito.asan` shows the crash log without the `incognito` flag (See the `ALLOCATE` stack).<!----></span><br><br>## FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<span class="line"><!---->## FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></span><br><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1284584#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139"><!---->1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139<!----></a><br>Author: Xinghui Lu <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Xinghui Lu &lt;<!----></span>xinghuilu@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/xinghuilu@chromium.org"><!---->xinghuilu@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Jan 14 01:35:00 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Jan 14 01:35:00 2022<!----></span><br><br>Remove pending download requests before the profile is destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->Remove pending download requests before the profile is destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>Currently, CheckClientDownloadRequestBase holds a raw pointer of<span class="line"><!---->Currently, CheckClientDownloadRequestBase holds a raw pointer of<!----></span><br>browser_context. If the function is triggered after the profile is<span class="line"><!---->browser_context. If the function is triggered after the profile is<!----></span><br>destroyed, it will cause UAF.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed, it will cause UAF.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<span class="line"><!---->will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<!----></span><br><br>A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<span class="line"><!---->A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<!----></span><br>service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown. This<span class="line"><!---->service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown. This<!----></span><br>fix will be addressed in a future CL.<span class="line"><!---->fix will be addressed in a future CL.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1284584<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

If the function is triggered after the profile is<span class="line"><!---->browser_context. If the function is triggered after the profile is<!----></span><br>destroyed, it will cause UAF.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed, it will cause UAF.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<span class="line"><!---->will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<!----></span><br><br>A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<span class="line"><!---->A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<!----></span><br>service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown. This<span class="line"><!---->service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown.         LTS Milestone M96<span class="line"><!---->LTS Milestone M96<!----></span><br><br>This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<span class="line"><!---->This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<!----></span><br>1. If the function is triggered after the profile is<span class="line"><!---->browser_context. If the function is triggered after the profile is<!----></span><br>destroyed, it will cause UAF.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed, it will cause UAF.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<span class="line"><!---->will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<!----></span><br><br>A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<span class="line"><!---->A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<!----></span><br>service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown. This<span class="line"><!---->service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

          </button>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {

          max-width: 1000px;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

          min-height: 100%;

            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>
      
        <div class="container-outside" id="issue">
          <aside class="metadata-container">
            <mr-issue-metadata></mr-issue-metadata>

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>

      content: "Feedback";
      font-size: 12px;
      left: 50%;
      opacity: 0;
      position: absolute;
      text-decoration: none;
      top: 28px;
      transform: translateX(-50%);
      transition: opacity .4s;
      -webkit-transform: translateX(-50%);
    }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

        }

          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;

          text-align: center;

    background: none;

    text-decoration: underline;

                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

          Backlog-Rank:<th title="Tracks the current rank of this item in the teams backlog"><!---->Backlog-Rank:</th>

      ## VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->## VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br><br>### Prolog<span class="line"><!---->### Prolog<!----></span><br><br>While closing a `FileSystemAccessFileWriter` (created from a non-sandboxed file system, eg. get from a file chooser dialog), `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start` will be invoked.<span class="line"><!---->While closing a `FileSystemAccessFileWriter` (created from a non-sandboxed file system, eg. get from a file chooser dialog), `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start` will be invoked.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>interface FileSystemAccessFileWriter {<span class="line"><!---->interface FileSystemAccessFileWriter {<!----></span><br>  // ...<span class="line"><!---->  // ...<!----></span><br>  Close() => (FileSystemAccessError result);<span class="line"><!---->  Close() =&gt; (FileSystemAccessError result);<!----></span><br>  // ...<span class="line"><!---->  // ...<!----></span><br>};<span class="line"><!---->};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/public/mojom/file_system_access/file_system_access_file_writer.mojom;drc=c7fa3ea1647b084f9aa790bf5be3a1ac58e3db78;l=30<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/public/mojom/file_system_access/file_system_access_file_writer.mojom;drc=c7fa3ea1647b084f9aa790bf5be3a1ac58e3db78;l=30"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/public/mojom/file_system_access/file_system_access_file_writer.mojom;drc=c7fa3ea1647b084f9aa790bf5be3a1ac58e3db78;l=30<!----></a><br><br>`CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start` will call `OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone`.<span class="line"><!---->`CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start` will call `OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone`.<!----></span><br><br>```C++<span class="line"><!---->```C++<!----></span><br>void CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start() {<span class="line"><!---->void CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start() {<!----></span><br>  // ...<span class="line"><!---->  // ...<!----></span><br><br>  // If allowlist check passes, FinishRequest() will be called to avoid<span class="line"><!---->  // If allowlist check passes, FinishRequest() will be called to avoid<!----></span><br>  // analyzing file. Otherwise, AnalyzeFile() will be called to continue with<span class="line"><!---->  // analyzing file. Otherwise, AnalyzeFile() will be called to continue with<!----></span><br>  // analysis.<span class="line"><!---->  // analysis.<!----></span><br>  content::GetIOThreadTaskRunner({})->PostTaskAndReplyWithResult(<span class="line"><!---->  content::GetIOThreadTaskRunner({})-&gt;PostTaskAndReplyWithResult(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&CheckUrlAgainstAllowlist, source_url_, database_manager_),<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;CheckUrlAgainstAllowlist, source_url_, database_manager_),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone,<!----></span><br>                     GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->                     GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/check_client_download_request_base.cc;drc=925075a7a9c7c21ec96d9ecad32ccf80e1ab6390;l=118<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/check_client_download_request_base.cc;drc=925075a7a9c7c21ec96d9ecad32ccf80e1ab6390;l=118"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/safe_browsing/download_protection/check_client_download_request_base.cc;drc=925075a7a9c7c21ec96d9ecad32ccf80e1ab6390;l=118<!----></a><br><br>The `OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone` will try to analyze the file content according to the file type in `DownloadRequestMaker::Start`. And `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::OnRequestBuilt` will be the callback for `DownloadRequestMaker::Start`.<span class="line"><!---->The `OnUrlAllowlistCheckDone` will try to analyze the file content according to the file type in `DownloadRequestMaker::Start`. And `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::OnRequestBuilt` will be the callback for `DownloadRequestMaker::Start`.<!----></span><br><br>```C++<span class="line"><!---->```C++<!----></span><br>void chain `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::OnURLLoaderComplete` => `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::FinishRequest` => `DownloadProtectionService::RequestFinished` => `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::FinishRequest` =&gt; `DownloadProtectionService::RequestFinished` =&gt; `MaybeLogSecuritySensitiveDownloadEvent` will be invoked.<!----></span><br><br>And a virtual function call to `BrowserContext` in `SafeBrowsingMetricsCollectorFactory::GetForProfile` leads to UAF.<span class="line"><!---->And a virtual function call to `BrowserContext` in `SafeBrowsingMetricsCollectorFactory::GetForProfile` leads to UAF.<!----></span><br><br>```C++<span class="line"><!---->```C++<!----></span><br>void MaybeLogSecuritySensitiveDownloadEvent(<span Fix<span class="line"><!---->## Fix<!----></span><br><br>An effective fix is to let `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase` and `DownloadRequestMaker` inherite the `WebContentsObserver` like this issue: <span class="line"><!---->An effective fix is to let `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase` and `DownloadRequestMaker` inherite the `WebContentsObserver` like this issue: <!----></span>https://crbug.com/1197904<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1197904" title="Security: UAF in NavigationPredictor"><!---->https://crbug.com/1197904<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>## VERSION<span class="line"><!---->## VERSION<!----></span><br><br>Chrome Version: 98.0.4701.0 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 98.0.4701.0 stable<!----></span><br><br>## REPRODUCTION CASE<span class="line"><!---->## REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></span><br><br>1. Run `mkdir gen && mv copy_mojo_js_bindings.py gen`<span class="line"><!---->1. Run `mkdir gen &amp;&amp; mv copy_mojo_js_bindings.py gen`<!----></span><br>2. Run `cd gen && python copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chromium/gen`<span class="line"><!---->2. Run `cd gen &amp;&amp; python copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chromium/gen`<!----></span><br>2. Host `chooser.html` with a web server, like `python3 -m http.server 8887`<span class="line"><!---->2. Host `chooser.html` with a web server, like `python3 -m http.server 8887`<!----></span><br>3. Run `./chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --incognito <span class="line"><!---->3. Run `./chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --incognito <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8887/chooser.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8887/chooser.html`"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8887/chooser.html`<!----></a><br>4. Click the "Trigger" Button. When a File Chooser Dialog is shown, click 'OK'<span class="line"><!---->4. Click the "Trigger" Button. When a File Chooser Dialog is shown, click 'OK'<!----></span><br><br>You may get 3 different ASAN logs.<span class="line"><!---->You may get 3 different ASAN logs.<!----></span><br><br>In `chooser.html`, I use `MojoJS` to reach the `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start`. But the MojoJS is not necessary since there is another way to reach there in **non-compromised** renderer. Check `download.html`.<span class="line"><!---->In `chooser.html`, I use `MojoJS` to reach the `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase::Start`. But the MojoJS is not necessary since there is another way to reach there in **non-compromised** renderer. Check `download.html`.<!----></span><br><br>Both `CheckClientDownloadRequest` and `CheckFileSystemAccessWriteRequest` inherit from `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase`. The above cases use `CheckFileSystemAccessWriteRequest` but the `CheckClientDownloadRequest` can also reach these code without user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->Both `CheckClientDownloadRequest` and `CheckFileSystemAccessWriteRequest` inherit from `CheckClientDownloadRequestBase`. The above cases use `CheckFileSystemAccessWriteRequest` but the `CheckClientDownloadRequest` can also reach these code without user interaction.<!----></span><br><br>I have tried to reproduce it without `--enable-blink-features=MojoJS` but have not succeeded yet.<span class="line"><!---->I have tried to reproduce it without `--enable-blink-features=MojoJS` but have not succeeded yet.<!----></span><br><br>The `incognito` is not necessary but can make it easy to win the race. The attachment `crash-1-non-incognito.asan` shows the crash log without the `incognito` flag (See the `ALLOCATE` stack).<span class="line"><!---->The `incognito` is not necessary but can make it easy to win the race. The attachment `crash-1-non-incognito.asan` shows the crash log without the `incognito` flag (See the `ALLOCATE` stack).<!----></span><br><br>## FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<span class="line"><!---->## FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></span><br><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139"><!---->1d9300c6ec561931739e5e756a15b81c0e775139<!----></a><br>Author: Xinghui Lu <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Xinghui Lu &lt;<!----></span>xinghuilu@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/xinghuilu@chromium.org"><!---->xinghuilu@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Jan 14 01:35:00 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Jan 14 01:35:00 2022<!----></span><br><br>Remove pending download requests before the profile is destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->Remove pending download requests before the profile is destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>Currently, CheckClientDownloadRequestBase holds a raw pointer of<span class="line"><!---->Currently, CheckClientDownloadRequestBase holds a raw pointer of<!----></span><br>browser_context. If the function is triggered after the profile is<span class="line"><!---->browser_context. If the function is triggered after the profile is<!----></span><br>destroyed, it will cause UAF.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed, it will cause UAF.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<span class="line"><!---->will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<!----></span><br><br>A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<span class="line"><!---->A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<!----></span><br>service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown. This<span class="line"><!---->service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown. This<!----></span><br>fix will be addressed in a future CL.<span class="line"><!---->fix will be addressed in a future CL.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1284584<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" If this merge addresses a major issue in the stable channel, does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->6.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/524b01441d1acbca385df54d82720fccbd48f168<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/524b01441d1acbca385df54d82720fccbd48f168"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/524b01441d1acbca385df54d82720fccbd48f168<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>524b01441d1acbca385df54d82720fccbd48f168<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/524b01441d1acbca385df54d82720fccbd48f168"><!---->524b01441d1acbca385df54d82720fccbd48f168<!----></a><br>Author: Xinghui Lu <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Xinghui Lu &lt;<!----></span>xinghuilu@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/xinghuilu@chromium.org"><!---->xinghuilu@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat Jan 22 03:23:36 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sat Jan 22 03:23:36 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M98] Remove pending download requests before the profile is destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->[M98] Remove pending download requests before the profile is destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>Currently, CheckClientDownloadRequestBase holds a raw pointer of<span class="line"><!---->Currently, CheckClientDownloadRequestBase holds a raw pointer of<!----></span><br>browser_context. If the function is triggered after the profile is<span class="line"><!---->browser_context. If the function is triggered after the profile is<!----></span><br>destroyed, it will cause UAF.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed, it will cause UAF.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<span class="line"><!---->will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<!----></span><br><br>A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<span class="line"><!---->A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<!----></span><br>service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown. This<span class="line"><!---->service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown. This<!----></span><br>fix will be addressed in a future CL.<span class="line"><!---->fix will be addressed in a future CL.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span If the function is triggered after the profile is<span class="line"><!---->browser_context. If the function is triggered after the profile is<!----></span><br>destroyed, it will cause UAF.<span class="line"><!---->destroyed, it will cause UAF.<!----></span><br><br>In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->In this CL, let SafeBrowsingService notify DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<span class="line"><!---->that the profile is going to be destroyed, and DownloadProtectionService<!----></span><br>will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<span class="line"><!---->will delete all pending requests that are associated with this profile.<!----></span><br><br>A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<span class="line"><!---->A long term fix would be making the DownloadProtectionService a keyed<!----></span><br>service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown. This<span class="line"><!---->service and removing the pending requests directly during shutdown.
